answers.answer: You should have prenatal care as soon as you are pregnant.  I think it is dangerous to wait that long.
what do i do the only other thing i can do it fly home and be there alone out there till april or may

17 weeks is a long time to wait to seek prenatal care.  Actually, it is 3 weeks shy of exactly half your pregnancy.  You have to do what you have to do.3 hours is a long time to travel, but the care may be worth it.  This is a personal decision, although; I feel that most women will strongly advise you to seek prenatal care.  If you cannot be seen every month, that is understandable...
i'm trying to do everything i can to get to some dr. i want a health baby
thank u i[m trying again to find some ways to be at a dr.i maybe have to just fly home

i agree with everyone else.  thats definitely too long to wait.  the first trimester is the most important in the growth and development of your baby.  Check into Planned Parenthood's around where you are, but you definitely need to see someone.  There are certain tests that doctors need to run to check on the health of your baby that need done between certain weeks of pregnancy.  waiting till 17 weeks would surpass some of those very important tests.  I doubt you'll find anyone who will give you the advice that it's okay to wait.  Some women can develop pre-eclampsia which is high blood pressure which puts mother AND child at risk, gestational diabetes, etc., and on and on.  There are way too many things that can go wrong that can put yours and your baby's health at risk to wait.If worse came to worst, the least you should do is TODAY go to Walmart and get some over the counter pre-natal vitamins and begin taking those.
tommorrow is 6 weeks i just find out last week

no you need to find someone to see you. its very important to have prenatal care before 17 weeks. you can switch when you move that is ok. for now either seek a dr where you live, or a clinic so you can get the treatment. are you taking your prenatals?? very important right now. eating healthy and no smoking or drinking (im sure you dont but you would be surprised what people say on here) good luck!!

i agree with finding someone, even if a clinic for now. there are so many factors you need to be evaluated for. your weight, blood pressure, babys heart beat. ect..how far along are you and have you seen a dr at all?
i had waited almost 12wks to go to a doctor when i was pregnant. some hospitals won't take you after a certain amount of weeks. they almost didn't accept me but i was lucky.

Call the City or County Community Center.  They should be able to refer you to a County facility for examination.  The costs should be minimal if any at all.  It will probably be a walk-in appt. but it's faster than waiting for a few more weeks.  You probably could contact a local hospital and ask them for local free or reduced costs facilities in your area.
